snippet: Training of some Afghan forces has been put on hold to conduct stricter vetting to root out any infiltrators who could pose risks to coalition troops working with them, American officials say.

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr

lead_paragraph: Training of some Afghan forces has been put on hold to conduct stricter vetting to root out any infiltrators who could pose risks to coalition troops working with them, American officials say.

headline.main: U.S. Halting Program to Train Afghan Recruits
